title: Swimming Through High Surf to Shore
brief: Technique for safely swimming through large waves and surf to reach shore.
steps: Step 1: Swim toward shore in the trough (low area) between waves, not on wave crests.
Step 2: When a seaward wave approaches, face it directly and submerge underwater.
Step 3: After the wave passes over you, surface and continue swimming toward shore in the next trough.
Step 4: If caught in undertow, push off the bottom or swim to surface, then proceed shoreward as above.
Step 5: Repeat this pattern of diving under approaching waves and swimming in troughs until you reach shallow water.
warnings: Never try to swim over or through breaking waves - they can drive you underwater and cause drowning.
Do not fight against strong undertow - work with the water's movement instead.
Conserve energy by timing your movements with wave patterns rather than fighting them.
